page.title: 14Parish Link in Kensworth
page.content: The Parish Link magazine is printed 10 times a year.It started life 3 years ago and replaced a Church Newsheet.The 1500 copies printed cover the 3 villages of Studham,Kensworth & Whipsnade.It is completely self financed;all editorial work,delivery etc.is voluntary and the printing paid for by advertising.A correspondent from each village writes their own newspage,and other pages contain a diary of local events,vicar's letter, parish register,small private adverts, letters to the editor,recipes etc. Ten months a year the editorial team of 4 meets to put the magazine together. After printing it is collated & stapled together by another team,then delivered to distributors,who in turn deliver a copy to each household in the 3 villages.The magazine thus forms a 'link' between the 3 villages.
